Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Perform a transformation of the plane defined by the coordinate system by adding a 3D rotation of the 2D sketch plane using the euler angles and a translation using the translation vector. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D solid body using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal = 0.0625 - Extrude depth opposite normal = 0.0 - Sketch scaling factor = 0.75 - Boolean operation = Create a new solid body Step 6: Add a central hole Create a second face of the sketch (face_2) and draw a circle with the following parameters: - Center Point = [0.0549, 0.3263] - Radius = 0.0382 Then, follow the same steps as before to extrude this 2D sketch to generate the 3D solid body for the central hole, ensuring that the boolean operation results in a cut in the previously created solid body. The resulting solid body should have the following dimensions: - Length = 0.75 - Width = 0.75 - Height = 0.0625</description>
